contentheadline.headline: Grammy Award for Best Rap Performance by a Duo or Group

contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} The [[Grammy Award]] for '''Best Rap Performance by a Duo or Group''' was awarded between 1991 and 2011, alongside the [[Grammy Award for Best Rap Solo Performance]]. Previously a single award was presented for [[Grammy Award for Best Rap Performance|Best Rap Performance]]. The award will be discontinued from 2012 in a major overhaul of Grammy categories. From 2012, all solo and duo/group rap performances will be shifted to the revived '''[[Grammy Award for Best Rap Performance | Best Rap Performance]]''' category. Years reflect the year in which the Grammy Awards were presented, for music released from October a year and a half prior to September the previous year. ==2010s== *[[Grammy Awards of 2011]] **[[Jay-Z]] & [[Swizz Beatz]] for "[[On to the Next One]]" *[[Grammy Awards of 2010]] **[[Eminem]], [[Dr. Dre]] & [[50 Cent]] for "[[Crack A Bottle]]" ==2000s== *[[Grammy Awards of 2009]] **[[T.I.]], [[Jay-Z]], [[Kanye West]], & [[Lil Wayne]] for "[[Swagga Like Us]]" *[[Grammy Awards of 2008]] **[[Common (rapper)|Common]] & [[Kanye West]] for [[Southside (Common song)|"Southside"]] *[[Grammy Awards of 2007]] **[[Chamillionaire]] & [[Krayzie Bone]] of [[Bone Thugs-n-Harmony]] for "[[Ridin']]" *[[Grammy Awards of 2006]] **[[The Black Eyed Peas]] for "[[Don't Phunk with My Heart]]" *[[Grammy Awards of 2005]] **[[The Black Eyed Peas]] for "[[Let's Get It Started]]" *[[Grammy Awards of 2004]] **[[Sean Combs|P.
